title: 403. The Opioid Tragedy, Part 2: “It’s Not a Death Sentence”
description: One prescription drug is keeping some addicts from dying. So why isn’t it more widespread? A story of regulation, stigma, and the potentially fatal faith in abstinence.
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
content:encoded: One prescription drug is keeping some addicts from dying. So why isn’t it more widespread? A story of regulation, stigma, and the potentially fatal faith in abstinence.
